title: Courteney Cox, 55, goes make-up free to meet up with Jaime King, 40, in LA
text:
They are both sitcom sweethearts, starring in Friends and Hart of Dixie respectively.

And it was a meeting of TV minds on Thursday, as Courteney Cox and Jaime King headed out in Los Angeles for a low-key outing.

The Scream star, 55, was showing off her youthful complexion as she went make-up free while Jaime, 40, donned a funky pair of snakeskin boots.

Relaxed: Courteney Cox, 55, sported a casual look as she dressed all in black in a T-shirt, smart three-quarter lengths and trainers while running errands in Los Angeles on Thursday

Courteney looked more relaxed than her neat-freak alter-ego Monica Geller, with her brunette locks hanging loosely around her shoulders as she spoke on the phone.

Keeping things chic, she donned head-to-toe black which made the most of her lithe figure while she stayed comfortable in trainers.

A simple leather bag and toned down make-up rounded off the look, with the actress clearly in familiar surroundings.

Sin City star Jaime looked equally casual as she sported a vest and slate grey harem trousers however she dressed up the look with off a pair of funky patterned cowboy boots as she enjoyed a cigarette.

Simple but stunning: She looked more relaxed than her neat-freak alter-ego Monica Geller, with her brunette locks hanging loosely around her shoulders as she spoke on the phone

Nice boots: And Sin City star Jaime, 40, looked equally casual as she sported a vest and slate grey harem trousers

With a pair of shades and her blonde tresses worn in shaggy waves to complete her look, Jaime nailed the casual ensemble to perfection.

Courteney's appearance comes following a report that her Friends character Monica and Matthew Perry's goofy Chandler Bing were not supposed to be a couple.

Yet fans demanded the union, making the writers create the romance, it has been revealed in a new book in honor of the show’s 25th anniversary.

Having a stroll: On her feet, the actress showed off a pair of funky patterned cowboy boots as she enjoyed a cigarette

Not so much... Courteney's appearance comes following a report that her Friends character Monica and Matthew Perry's goofy Chandler Bing were not supposed to be a couple (pictured on the show in 2001)

And not only did the two hook up, but they also tied the knot and ended up having two kids - Erica and Jack - over the 10-year run of the show.

Meanwhile, Jaime's last outing came at the end of last month when she helped raise money for the Huntingdon's Disease Society of America (HDSA) at the 5th Annual Freeze HD Gala in Hollywood.

She was joined at the charity event by her husband Kyle Newman, who she married in 2007 after the pair's meeting on the set of Fanboys in 2006.
